    button_parameters.position = {-11.5, 1, 18}
    button_parameters.rotation = {0,-90,0}
    button_parameters.width = 2000
    button_parameters.height = 400
    button_parameters.font_size = 300
    self.removeButton(0)
    self.createButton(button_parameters)
end

function quitGame()
    local button_parameters = {}
    button_parameters.click_function = 'doNothing'
    button_parameters.function_owner = self
    button_parameters.label = 'Concede?'
    button_parameters.position = {-1,2,0}
    button_parameters.rotation = {0,-90,0}
    button_parameters.width = 2000
    button_parameters.height = 400
    button_parameters.font_size = 300
    self.removeButton(0)
    self.createButton(button_parameters)

    button_parameters.click_function = 'confirmQuit'
    button_parameters.function_owner = self
    button_parameters.label = 'Yes'
    button_parameters.position = {1,2,1.5}
    button_parameters.rotation = {0,-90,0}
    button_parameters.width = 600
    button_parameters.height = 400
    button_parameters.font_size = 300
    self.createButton(button_parameters)

    button_parameters.click_function = 'resetButton'
    button_parameters.function_owner = self
    button_parameters.label = 'No'
    button_parameters.position = {1,2,-1.5}
    button_parameters.rotation = {0,-90,0}
    button_parameters.width = 600
    button_parameters.height = 400
    button_parameters.font_size = 300
    self.createButton(button_parameters)
end

function resetButton()
    self.removeButton(0)
    self.removeButton(1)
    self.removeButton(2)

    local button_parameters = {}
    button_parameters.click_function = 'quitGame'
    button_parameters.function_owner = self
    button_parameters.label = 'Concede'
    button_parameters.position = {-11.5, 1, 18}
    button_parameters.rotation = {0,-90,0}
    button_parameters.width = 2000
    button_parameters.height = 400
    button_parameters.font_size = 300
    self.createButton(button_parameters)
end

function confirmQuit()
    local function_parameters = {leavecolor = 'Pink'}
    Global.call('leavePlayer', function_parameters)
    self.removeButton(0)
    self.removeButton(1)
    self.removeButton(2)

    local button_parameters = {}
    button_parameters.click_function = 'readyUp'
    button_parameters.function_owner = self
    button_parameters.label = 'Ready to Play'
    button_parameters.position = {0, 2, 0}
    button_parameters.rotation = {0,-90,0}
    button_parameters.width = 2000
    button_parameters.height = 400
    button_parameters.font_size = 300
    self.createButton(button_parameters)
end

function doNothing()
    --You guessed it
end

ObjectStates.Name: Custom_Tile
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
--By Tipsy Hobbit
local basic_buttons = {}
local encodedObjects = {}
local version = 4.4
local modAm = 1
local zone = nil
local hasMoved = 1

function onLoad(saved_data)
  --print('MTG Card Encoder '..version)
  basic_buttons['Encoder'] = {click_function='addCards',function_owner=self,label='Add Card',position={0.25,0.1,0.62},rotation={0,0,0},width=480,height=80,font_size=80}
  --The Counter Encoder Button
  basic_buttons['CounterEncode'] = {click_function='toggleCounter',function_owner=self,label='Counters',position={-0.60,0.1,0.15},rotation={0,0,0},width=400,height=80,font_size=80}
  --The Base Stats Encoder Button
  basic_buttons['BasePTEncode'] = {click_function='toggleBasePT',function_owner=self,label='Base P/T',position={-0.60,0.1,-0.2},rotation={0,0,0},width=400,height=80,font_size=80}
  --The Loyalty Encoder Button
  basic_buttons['LoyaltyEncode'] = {click_function='toggleLoyalty',function_owner=self,label='Loyalty',position={-0.60,0.1,0.5},rotation={0,0,0},width=400,height=80,font_size=80}

  if saved_data ~= nil and saved_data ~= "" then
    loaded_data = JSON.decode(saved_data)
    for i,v in pairs(loaded_data) do
      if i ~= nil and v ~= nil and v ~= "" then
        encodedObjects[i] = JSON.decode(v)
        encodedObjects[i].this = getObjectFromGUID(i)
        if encodedObjects[i].this == nil then
          Table.remove(encodedObjects,i)
        end
      end
    end
  else
    encodedObjects = {}
  end
  for i,v in pairs(encodedObjects) do
    createButtons(v.this)
  end

  createEncoderButtons()
end

function onSave()
  local data_to_save = {}
  for i,v in pairs(encodedObjects) do
    --Removing Object reference before encoding.
    if encodedObjects[i].this ~= nil then
      local tempThis = encodedObjects[i].this
      encodedObjects[i].this = ""
      data_to_save[i] = JSON.encode(v)
      encodedObjects[i].this = tempThis
    end
  end
  saved_data = JSON.encode(data_to_save)
  return saved_data
end

function onObjectDestroyed(obj)
  if obj == self then
    for i,v in pairs(encodedObjects) do
      v.this.clearButtons()
      v.this.setName(v.name)
    end
    if zone ~= nil then
      destroyObject(zone)
    end
  end
end

function doNothing()
end

function createEncoderButtons()
  for i,v in pairs(basic_buttons) do
    self.createButton(v)
  end
end

function getCards()
    --print(self.getScale()[1]..", "..self.getScale()[2]..", "..self.getScale()[3])
    if hasMoved == 1 then
        print("Reseting Counting Zone")
        hasMoved = 0
        local params = {}
        params.type = "scriptingTrigger"
        params.position = self.getPosition()
        params.rotation = self.getRotation()
        params.scale = {1.9*self.getScale()[1], 4*self.getScale()[2], 1.9*self.getScale()[3]}
        zone = spawnObject(params)
    end
    if zone ~= nil then
        return zone.getObjects(), #zone.getObjects()
    end
    return {},0
end

function onPickedUp(ply)
    hasMoved = 1
    if zone ~= nil then
        destroyObject(zone)
    end
end

function addCards()
  procobjects, rcds = getCards()
  if rcds==0 then
  else
    for i,v in pairs(procobjects) do
      if v.tag == 'Card' or v.tag == 'Deck' then
        if encodedObjects[v.getGUID()] == nil then
          encodedObjects[v.getGUID()] = {this=v,base={power=0,toughness=0},coun={plusP=0,plusT=0},loyalty=0,toggle={base=0,coun=0,loyalty=0,editing=0},name=v.getName()}
        end
      end
    end
  end
end

function toggleBasePT()
  procobjects, rcds = getCards()
  if rcds==0 then
  else
    for i,v in pairs(procobjects) do
      local temp = encodedObjects[v.getGUID()]
      if temp ~= nil then
        temp.toggle.base = (temp.toggle.base+1)%2
        temp.this = getObjectFromGUID(temp.this.getGUID())
        temp.this.clearButtons()
        createButtons(temp.this)
      end
    end
  end
end

function toggleCounter()
  procobjects, rcds = getCards()
  if rcds==0 then
  else
    for i,v in pairs(procobjects) do
      local temp = encodedObjects[v.getGUID()]
      if temp ~= nil then
        temp.toggle.coun = (temp.toggle.coun+1)%2
        temp.this = getObjectFromGUID(temp.this.getGUID())
        temp.this.clearButtons()
        createButtons(temp.this)
      end
    end
  end
end

function toggleLoyalty()
  procobjects, rcds = getCards()
  if rcds==0 then
  else
    for i,v in pairs(procobjects) do
      local temp = encodedObjects[v.getGUID()]
      if temp ~= nil then
        temp.this = getObjectFromGUID(temp.this.getGUID())
        temp.toggle.loyalty = (temp.toggle.loyalty+1)%2
        temp.this.clearButtons()
        createButtons(temp.this)
      end
    end
  end
end

function distance ( x, y, x2, y2 )
  local dx, dy = x2 - x, y2 - y
  return math.sqrt ( dx * dx + dy * dy )
end

function updateSize(temp)
  	size = #temp*85
  	offset = (#temp-3)/2*0.15
  	return size,offset
end

function createButtons(tar)
  local name = ""
  local size = 0
  local offset = 0
  local temp = ""
  if encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.base == 1 then
    temp = ""..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.power..'/'..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.toughness
    size,offset = updateSize(temp)
    tar.createButton({
    label=temp, click_function='toggleBaseEditor', function_owner=self,
    position={0.75-offset,0.28,1.4}, height=170, width=size, font_size=150
    })
    name= name..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.power..'/'..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.toughness.." "
  end
  local symA = (encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusP < 0) and "" or "+"
  local symB = (encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusT < 0) and "" or "+"
  if encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.coun == 1 then
    temp = symA..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusP..'/'..symB..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusT
    size,offset = updateSize(temp)
    tar.createButton({
    label=symA..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusP..'/'..symB..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusT, click_function='toggleCounEditor', function_owner=self,
    position={0.75-offset,0.28,1.1}, height=170, width=size, font_size=150
    })
    name=name.."("..symA..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusP..'/'..symB..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusT..") "
  end
  name=name..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].name
  if encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.loyalty == 1 then
    tar.createButton({
    label=""..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].loyalty, click_function='toggleLoyaEditor', function_owner=self,
    position={-0.8,0.28,1.4}, height=170, width=270, font_size=150
    })
    name=name.." ("..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].loyalty..")"
  end
  tar.setName(name)
end

function toggleBaseEditor(tar)
  encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing = 1
  toggleDisplay(tar)
end
function toggleCounEditor(tar)
  encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing = 2
  toggleDisplay(tar)
end
function toggleLoyaEditor(tar)
  encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing = 3
  toggleDisplay(tar)
end
function toggleEditor(tar)
  encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing = 0
  tar.clearButtons()
  createButtons(tar)
end


--Editor Display
function toggleDisplay(tar)
    tar.clearButtons()
    if encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 1 then
      tar.createButton({
      label=""..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.power..'/'..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.toughness, click_function='toggleEditor', function_owner=self,
      position={0,0.28,0}, height=400, width=840, font_size=400
      })
    elseif encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 2 then
      tar.createButton({
      label=""..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusP..'/'..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusT, click_function='toggleEditor', function_owner=self,
      position={0,0.28,0}, height=400, width=840, font_size=400
      })
    elseif encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 3 then
      tar.createButton({
      label=""..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].loyalty, click_function='toggleEditor', function_owner=self,
      position={0,0.28,0}, height=400, width=840, font_size=400
      })
    end
    createModButtons(tar)
end
function updateEdDisplay(tar)
  tar.editButton({
  index=1,label=""..modAm, click_function='cycleAm', function_owner=self,
  position={0.0,0.28,-0.9}, height=400, width=800, font_size=240
  })
  if encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 1 then
    tar.editButton({
    index=0,label=""..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.power..'/'..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.toughness, click_function='toggleEditor', function_owner=self,
    position={0,0.28,0}, height=400, width=840, font_size=400
    })
  elseif encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 2 then
    tar.editButton({
    index=0,label=""..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusP..'/'..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusT, click_function='toggleEditor', function_owner=self,
    position={0,0.28,0}, height=400, width=840, font_size=400
    })
  elseif encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 3 then
    tar.editButton({
    index=0,label=""..encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].loyalty, click_function='toggleEditor', function_owner=self,
    position={0,0.28,0}, height=400, width=840, font_size=400
    })
  end
end

function createModButtons(tar)
  tar.createButton({
  label= ""..modAm, click_function='cycleAm', function_owner=self,
  position={0.0,0.28,-0.9}, height=400, width=800, font_size=240
  })
  tar.createButton({
  label= "Clear", click_function='clear', function_owner=self,
  position={0.0,0.28,0.9}, height=400, width=800, font_size=240
  })
  tar.createButton({
  label="+", click_function='addB', function_owner=self,
  position={0.0,0.28,-1.8}, height=400, width=800, font_size=480
  })
  tar.createButton({
  label="-", click_function='subB', function_owner=self,
  position={0,0.28,1.8}, height=400, width=800, font_size=480
  })
  if(encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 1 or encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 2) then
    tar.createButton({
    label="+", click_function='addP', function_owner=self,
    position={-1.8,0.28,-0.45}, height=300, width=300, font_size=480
    })
    tar.createButton({
    label="-", click_function='subP', function_owner=self,
    position={-1.8,0.28,0.45}, height=300, width=300, font_size=480
    })
    tar.createButton({
    label="+", click_function='addT', function_owner=self,
    position={1.8,0.28,-0.45}, height=300, width=300, font_size=480
    })
    tar.createButton({
    label="-", click_function='subT', function_owner=self,
    position={1.8,0.28,0.45}, height=300, width=300, font_size=480
    })
  end
end

--Editor Functions
function clear(tar)
  if(encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 1) then
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.power = 0
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.toughness = 0
  elseif(encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 2) then
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusP = 0
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusT = 0
  elseif(encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 3) then
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].loyalty = 0
  end
  updateEdDisplay(tar)
end
function addB(tar)
  if(encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 1) then
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.power = encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.power + modAm
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.toughness = encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.toughness + modAm
  elseif(encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 2) then
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusP = encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusP + modAm
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusT = encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusT + modAm
  elseif(encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 3) then
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].loyalty = encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].loyalty + modAm
  end
  updateEdDisplay(tar)
end
function subB(tar)
  if(encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 1) then
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.power = encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.power - modAm
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.toughness = encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.toughness - modAm
  elseif(encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 2) then
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusP = encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusP - modAm
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusT = encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusT - modAm
  elseif(encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 3) then
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].loyalty = encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].loyalty - modAm
  end
  updateEdDisplay(tar)
end
function addP(tar)
  if(encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 1) then
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.power = encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.power + modAm
  elseif(encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 2) then
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusP = encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusP + modAm
  end
  updateEdDisplay(tar)
end
function subP(tar)
  if(encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 1) then
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.power = encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.power - modAm
  elseif(encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 2) then
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusP = encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusP - modAm
  end
  updateEdDisplay(tar)
end
function addT(tar)
  if(encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 1) then
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.toughness = encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.toughness + modAm
  elseif(encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 2) then
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusT = encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusT + modAm
  end
  updateEdDisplay(tar)
end
function subT(tar)
  if(encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 1) then
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.toughness = encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].base.toughness - modAm
  elseif(encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].toggle.editing == 2) then
    encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusT = encodedObjects[tar.getGUID()].coun.plusT - modAm
  end
  updateEdDisplay(tar)
end

--Cycle Functions
function cycleAm(tar)
  if modAm == 1 then modAm = 10
  elseif modAm == 10 then modAm = 1
  end
  updateEdDisplay(tar)
end

ObjectStates.Name: Bag
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
colorIndex = {}
colorIndex[1] = "r"
colorIndex[2] = "g"
colorIndex[3] = "b"

colorIndexNum = 1

COLOR_INCREMENT = 0.005

lastColor = nil

function onLoad()

	self.setColorTint({1, 0, 0})

end

function update()

	local firstColIndex = colorIndex[colorIndexNum]
	local secondColIndex = nil

	if colorIndexNum == 3 then
		secondColIndex = colorIndex[1]
	else
		secondColIndex = colorIndex[colorIndexNum + 1]
	end

	local colorTint = self.getColorTint()
	lastColor = colorTint

	if colorTint[secondColIndex] < 1 then

		colorTint[secondColIndex] = colorTint[secondColIndex] + COLOR_INCREMENT

		self.setColorTint(colorTint)

	elseif colorTint[firstColIndex] > 0 then

		colorTint[firstColIndex] = colorTint[firstColIndex] - COLOR_INCREMENT

		self.setColorTint(colorTint)

	else

		if colorIndexNum < 3 then
			colorIndexNum = colorIndexNum + 1
		else
			colorIndexNum = 1
		end

	end

	if lastColor == self.getColorTint() then

		self.setColorTint({1, 1, 1})

	end

end

ObjectStates.Name: Custom_Model
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
--[[
   card counter
   created by Rodney
]]

cardCounterVersion = "2016111300"

-- constants --
playerColorTable = {}
for i, v in ipairs({"White", "Brown", "Red", "Orange", "Yellow", "Green", "Teal", "Blue", "Purple", "Pink", "Black", "Grey"}) do
   playerColorTable[string.lower(v)] = v
end

-- customizable options in card counter's description part.
optionDescriptor = {
   -- text color.
   -- color name (same as seat name; White, Red...) or "#rrggbb" are supported.
   color = {
      type = "custom",
      decoder = function(value, optionChunk)
         local result
         local regularizedColorName = playerColorTable[string.lower(value)]

         if regularizedColorName then
            local rgb = stringColorToRGB(regularizedColorName)
            result = {rgb.r, rgb.g, rgb.b}
         else
            result = hexColorStringToRGB(value) or {1, 1, 1}
         end

         return result
      end,

      default = {1, 1, 1}
   },

   -- text size.
   size = {
      type = "number",
      default = 44
   },

   -- text format.
   -- See http://www.lua.org/manual/5.2/manual.html#pdf-string.format
   format = {
      type = "string",
      default = "x%d"
   },

   -- text offset position.
   offset = {
      type = "custom",
      decoder = function(value, optionChunk)
         local result = split(value, ",")

         result[1] = tonumber(result[1]) or 0
         result[2] = tonumber(result[2]) or 0
         result[3] = tonumber(result[3]) or 0

         return result
      end,
      default = {0, 0, 0}
   },

   -- text rotation.
   rotation = {
      type = "number",
      default = 0
   },

   -- raise text to deck's height.
   -- if this is true, text is raised to fit to deck's height.
   raise = {
      type = "boolean",
      default = true
   },

   -- aspect ratio.
   -- vertical / horizontal scale.
   aspectratio = {
      type = "number",
      default = 1
   }
}


-- target object's GUID/label text's GUID association table
labelAssoc = {}

-- currently spawning labels (not initialized)
spawningLabels = {}

-- label's temporary spawning position
tempPosition = {0, -30, 0}


-- workaround variable for onLoad/onCollisionEnter event's order.
beforeLoading = true
collideBeforeLoadQueue = {}

-- events --
function onSave()
   return JSON.encode(labelAssoc)
end

function onLoad(saved)
   if saved then
      labelAssoc = JSON.decode(saved) or {}
   end

   for t, l in pairs(labelAssoc) do
      local target = getObjectFromGUID(t)
      local label = getObjectFromGUID(l)

      if label == nil then
         labelAssoc[t] = nil
      elseif target == nil then
         labelAssoc[t] = nil
         label.destruct()
      end
   end

   beforeLoading = false

   for i, v in ipairs(collideBeforeLoadQueue) do
      onCollisionEnter(v)
   end
   collideBeforeLoadQueue = {}

   fixAspectRatio()
end

function onDestroy()
   for t, l in pairs(labelAssoc) do
      destroyLabel(t)
   end
end

function onCollisionEnter(info)
   if info and info.collision_object.guid then
      if beforeLoading then
         collideBeforeLoadQueue[#collideBeforeLoadQueue+1] = info
         return
      end

      local options = decodeOptionText(self.getDescription(), optionDescriptor)
      local target = getObjectFromGUID(info.collision_object.guid)
      local count = -1

      if target.tag == "Card" then
         count = 1
      elseif target.tag == "Deck" then
         count = #target.getObjects()
      end

      -- card/deck only
      if count > -1 then
         if count == 0  then
            destroyLabel(target.guid)
         else
            setLabelText(target.guid, count)
         end
      end
   end
end

function onCollisionExit(info)
   if info and info.collision_object.guid and labelAssoc[info.collision_object.guid] then
      destroyLabel(info.collision_object.guid)
   end
end

function onObjectDestroyed(target)
   if labelAssoc[target.guid] then
      destroyLabel(target.guid)
   end
end

function onPickedUp()
   for t, l in pairs(labelAssoc) do
      destroyLabel(t)
   end

   fixAspectRatio()
end

-- functions --

-- create new label text ofject for targetGuid.
-- this function uses asynchronously callback, so needs mutex variable.
function newLabel(targetGuid, params)
   if spawningLabels[targetGuid] then
      return
   end

   local label = spawnObject({
         type = "3DText",
         position = tempPosition,
         rotation = {0, 0, 0},
         callback = "newLabelCallback",
         callback_owner = self,
         params = {
            targetGuid = targetGuid,
            count = params.count
         }
   })

   spawningLabels[targetGuid] = label

   return label
end

-- callback function for spawning label text object.
function newLabelCallback(spawnedLabel, params)
   if params.targetGuid then
      labelAssoc[params.targetGuid] = spawnedLabel.guid
      local target = getObjectFromGUID(params.targetGuid)

      -- move functions only affects after initialized.
      moveLabel(getObjectFromGUID(params.targetGuid), spawnedLabel, params.count)
   end

   spawningLabels[params.targetGuid] = nil
end

-- set label's text for targetGuid.
-- if label object isn't found, new entity is spawned.
function setLabelText(targetGuid, count)
   local options = decodeOptionText(self.getDescription(), optionDescriptor)
   local label = getObjectFromGUID(labelAssoc[targetGuid])

   if not label then
      label = spawningLabels[targetGuid] or newLabel(targetGuid, {count = count})
   end

   local target = getObjectFromGUID(targetGuid)

   -- rare case: target is destroyed after new label is spawned but not initialized.
   if target == nil then
      destroyLabel(targetGuid)
      return
   end

   -- format text
   label.TextTool.setValue(string.format(options.format, count))
   label.TextTool.setFontColor(options.color)
   label.TextTool.setFontSize(options.size * target.getScale().x)

   -- if already initialized, move here.
   if label.guid then
      moveLabel(target, label, count)
   end
end

function moveLabel(target, label, count)
   local options = decodeOptionText(self.getDescription(), optionDescriptor)

   -- move label position
   local raised = 0.165

   if count ~= nil and options.raise then
      if count < 10 then
         raised = 0.17
      elseif count > 214 then
         raised = raised + 0.00966 * (214 - 10)
      else
         raised = raised + 0.00966 * (count - 10)
      end
   end

   local zFace = 0
   local offsetDirection = 1
   local origin = {
      position = target.getPosition(),
      rotation = target.getRotation(),
      scale = target.getScale()
   }

   -- flipped?
   if origin.rotation.z > 90 and origin.rotation.z < 270 then
      zFace = 180
      offsetDirection = -1
   end

   -- fix height & scale
   -- origin.position.y = self.getPosition().y
   origin.scale.y = 1.0

   local result = calcRelativePosition(origin, {
                                          position = {
                                             offsetDirection * -options.offset[1],
                                             -- offsetDirection * (options.offset[2] + raised),
                                             offsetDirection * (options.offset[2] + raised / 2),
                                             options.offset[3]
                                          },

   })

   label.setRotation(result.rotation)
end

function destroyLabel(targetGuid)

   if label then

      spawningLabels[targetGuid] = nil
   end
end

-- fix aspect ratio of card counter itself.
function fixAspectRatio()
   local options = decodeOptionText(self.getDescription(), optionDescriptor)
   local scale = self.getScale()

   scale.z = scale.x * options.aspectratio

   self.setScale(scale)
end

---- utility functions

-- spawn object at relative position of baseObj
--  origin : origin object position, rotation and scale
--   {position = {x = xpos, y = ypos, z = zpos}, rotation = {x = xrot, y = yrot, z = zrot, scale = {x = xscale, y = yscale, z = zscale}}}
--  objParam : object parameter. position and rotation is relative.
--  => objParam
function calcRelativePosition(origin, objParam)
   -- calc scaled position
   objParam.position[1] = objParam.position[1] * origin.scale.x
   objParam.position[2] = objParam.position[2] * origin.scale.y
   objParam.position[3] = objParam.position[3] * origin.scale.z

   -- calc absolute rotation
   objParam.rotation[1] = objParam.rotation[1] + origin.rotation.x
   objParam.rotation[2] = objParam.rotation[2] + origin.rotation.y
   objParam.rotation[3] = objParam.rotation[3] + origin.rotation.z

   -- calc absolute position
   -- y rotation only
   local cosX = math.cos(math.rad(origin.rotation.x))
   local sinX = math.sin(math.rad(origin.rotation.x))
   local cosY = math.cos(math.rad(origin.rotation.y))
   local sinY = math.sin(math.rad(origin.rotation.y))
   local cosZ = math.cos(math.rad(origin.rotation.z))
   local sinZ = math.sin(math.rad(origin.rotation.z))
   local x, y, z = objParam.position[1], objParam.position[2], objParam.position[3]

   -- TTS rotation order: Z-X-Y (same as Unity)

   -- rotate Z axis
   local x1 = x * cosZ - y * sinZ
   local y1 = x * sinZ + y * cosZ
   local z1 = z

   -- rotate X axis
   local x2 = x1
   local y2 = y1 * cosX - z1 * sinX
   local z2 = y1 * sinX + z1 * cosX

   -- rotate Y axis
   local x3 = x2 * cosY + z2 * sinY
   local y3 = y2
   local z3 = -x2 * sinY + z2 * cosY

   objParam.position[1] = x3 + origin.position.x
   objParam.position[2] = y3 + origin.position.y
   objParam.position[3] = z3 + origin.position.z

   return objParam
end

-- convert key=value list to table
--  optionText : string of key(delim)value list delimited by newline
--  descriptor : option entry descriptor
-- => table of key/value
function decodeOptionText(optionText, descriptor)
   local booleanTable = {["true"] = true, ["false"] = false}
   local result = {}

   for i, line in ipairs(split(optionText, "\n")) do
      local key, value = string.match(line, "^%s*([^%s=]+)%s*=%s*(.-)%s*$")
      if key ~= nil then
         key = string.lower(key)

         descEntry = descriptor[key]

         if descEntry then
            if descEntry.type == "select" and descEntry.values then
               value = descEntry.values[string.lower(value)]
            elseif descEntry.type == "boolean" then
               value = booleanTable[string.lower(value)]
            elseif descEntry.type == "number" then
               value = tonumber(value)
            elseif descEntry.type == "custom" and descEntry.decoder then
               value = descEntry.decoder(value, result)
            end
         end

         result[key] = value
      end
   end

   -- recover default value
   for key, descEntry in pairs(descriptor) do
      if result[key] == nil then
         result[key] = descEntry.default
      end
   end

   return result
end

-- split str by delim
--  str : string
--  delim : string
-- => table of string
function split(str, delim)
   local wordStart = 1
   local result = {}

   repeat
      local delimStart, delimEnd = string.find(str, delim, wordStart, 1)

      if delimStart ~= nil then
	 result[#result+1] = string.sub(str, wordStart, delimStart - 1)
	 wordStart = delimEnd + 1
      end
   until delimStart == nil

   result[#result+1] = string.sub(str, wordStart)
   return result
end

-- split "#rrggbb" style color string to "rr", "gg", "bb"
--  hexStr : string
--  => "rr", "gg", "bb"
function splitHexColorString(hexStr)
   if hexStr == nil then
      return nil
   end

   return string.match(hexStr,
                       "^#([%da-fA-F][%da-fA-F])" ..
                          "([%da-fA-F][%da-fA-F])" ..
                          "([%da-fA-F][%da-fA-F])$")
end

-- convert "#rrggbb" style color string to {r, g, b}
--  each element takes between 0 and 1 value.
--  hexStr : string
--  => {r, g, b}
function hexColorStringToRGB(hexStr)
   local result = nil

   local r, g, b = splitHexColorString(hexStr)
   if r then
      result = {tonumber(r, 16) / 255, tonumber(g, 16) / 255, tonumber(b, 16) / 255}
   end
   return result
end

--[[

cardCounterVersion = "2016111300"

-- constants --
playerColorTable = {}
for i, v in ipairs({"White", "Brown", "Red", "Orange", "Yellow", "Green", "Teal", "Blue", "Purple", "Pink", "Black", "Grey"}) do
   playerColorTable[string.lower(v)] = v
end

-- customizable options in card counter's description part.
optionDescriptor = {
   -- text color.
   -- color name (same as seat name; White, Red...) or "#rrggbb" are supported.
   color = {
      type = "custom",
      decoder = function(value, optionChunk)
         local result
         local regularizedColorName = playerColorTable[string.lower(value)]

         if regularizedColorName then
            local rgb = stringColorToRGB(regularizedColorName)
            result = {rgb.r, rgb.g, rgb.b}
         else
            result = hexColorStringToRGB(value) or {1, 1, 1}
         end

         return result
      end,

      default = {1, 1, 1}
   },

   -- text size.
   size = {
      type = "number",
      default = 44
   },

   -- text format.
   -- See http://www.lua.org/manual/5.2/manual.html#pdf-string.format
   format = {
      type = "string",
      default = "x%d"
   },

   -- text offset position.
   offset = {
      type = "custom",
      decoder = function(value, optionChunk)
         local result = split(value, ",")

         result[1] = tonumber(result[1]) or 0
         result[2] = tonumber(result[2]) or 0
         result[3] = tonumber(result[3]) or 0

         return result
      end,
      default = {0, 0, 0}
   },

   -- text rotation.
   rotation = {
      type = "number",
      default = 0
   },

   -- raise text to deck's height.
   -- if this is true, text is raised to fit to deck's height.
   raise = {
      type = "boolean",
      default = true
   },

   -- aspect ratio.
   -- vertical / horizontal scale.
   aspectratio = {
      type = "number",
      default = 1
   }
}

spawningLabels = {}

tempPosition = {0, -30, 0}

collideBeforeLoadQueue = {}

   return JSON.encode(labelAssoc)
end

   if saved then
      labelAssoc = JSON.decode(saved) or {}
   end

   for t, l in pairs(labelAssoc) do
      local target = getObjectFromGUID(t)
      local label = getObjectFromGUID(l)

      if label == nil then
         labelAssoc[t] = nil
      elseif target == nil then
         labelAssoc[t] = nil
         label.destruct()
      end
   end

   beforeLoading = false

   for i, v in ipairs(collideBeforeLoadQueue) do
      onCollisionEnter(v)
   end
   collideBeforeLoadQueue = {}

   fixAspectRatio()
end

function onDestroy()
   for t, l in pairs(labelAssoc) do
      destroyLabel(t)
   end

function onCollisionEnter(info)
   if info and info.collision_object.guid then
      if beforeLoading then
         collideBeforeLoadQueue[#collideBeforeLoadQueue+1] = info
         return
      end

      local options = decodeOptionText(self.getDescription(), optionDescriptor)
      local target = getObjectFromGUID(info.collision_object.guid)
      local count = -1

      if target.tag == "Card" then
         count = 1
      elseif target.tag == "Deck" then
         count = #target.getObjects()
      end

      -- card/deck only
      if count > -1 then
         if count == 0  then
            destroyLabel(target.guid)
         else
            setLabelText(target.guid, count)
         end
      end
   end
end

function onCollisionExit(info)
   if info and info.collision_object.guid and labelAssoc[info.collision_object.guid] then
      destroyLabel(info.collision_object.guid)
   end
end

function onObjectDestroyed(target)
   if labelAssoc[target.guid] then
      destroyLabel(target.guid)
   end
end

function onPickedUp()
   for t, l in pairs(labelAssoc) do
      destroyLabel(t)
   end

   fixAspectRatio()

   if spawningLabels[targetGuid] then

         rotation = {0, 0, 0},
         callback = "newLabelCallback",

         callback = "newLabelCallback",
         callback_owner = self,
         params = {
            targetGuid = targetGuid,
            count = params.count
         }
   })

   spawningLabels[targetGuid] = label

   return label
end

-- callback function for spawning label text object.
function newLabelCallback(spawnedLabel, params)
   if params.targetGuid then
      labelAssoc[params.targetGuid] = spawnedLabel.guid
      local target = getObjectFromGUID(params.targetGuid)

      -- move functions only affects after initialized.
      moveLabel(getObjectFromGUID(params.targetGuid), spawnedLabel, params.count)
   end

   spawningLabels[params.targetGuid] = nil
end

-- set label's text for targetGuid.
-- if label object isn't found, new entity is spawned.
function setLabelText(targetGuid, count)
   local options = decodeOptionText(self.getDescription(), optionDescriptor)
   local label = getObjectFromGUID(labelAssoc[targetGuid])

   if not label then
      label = spawningLabels[targetGuid] or newLabel(targetGuid, {count = count})
   end

   local target = getObjectFromGUID(targetGuid)

   -- rare case: target is destroyed after new label is spawned but not initialized.
   if target == nil then
      destroyLabel(targetGuid)
      return
   end

   -- format text
   label.TextTool.setValue(string.format(options.format, count))
   label.TextTool.setFontColor(options.color)
   label.TextTool.setFontSize(options.size * target.getScale().x)

   -- if already initialized, move here.
   if label.guid then
      moveLabel(target, label, count)
   end
end

function moveLabel(target, label, count)
   local options = decodeOptionText(self.getDescription(), optionDescriptor)

   -- move label position
   local raised = 0.165

   if count ~= nil and options.raise then
      if count < 10 then
         raised = 0.17
      elseif count > 214 then
         raised = raised + 0.00966 * (214 - 10)
      else
         raised = raised + 0.00966 * (count - 10)
      end
   end

   local zFace = 0
   local offsetDirection = 1
   local origin = {
      position = target.getPosition(),
      rotation = target.getRotation(),
      scale = target.getScale()
   }

   -- flipped?
   if origin.rotation.z > 90 and origin.rotation.z < 270 then
      zFace = 180
      offsetDirection = -1
   end

   -- fix height & scale
   -- origin.position.y = self.getPosition().y
   origin.scale.y = 1.0

   local result = calcRelativePosition(origin, {
                                          position = {
                                             offsetDirection * -options.offset[1],
                                             -- offsetDirection * (options.offset[2] + raised),
                                             offsetDirection * (options.offset[2] + raised / 2),
                                             options.offset[3]
                                          },
                                          rotation = {90, 180 + options.rotation, zFace}
   })

   label.setPosition(result.position)
   label.setRotation(result.rotation)
end

-- destroy label object for targetGuid.
function destroyLabel(targetGuid)
   local label = getObjectFromGUID(labelAssoc[targetGuid]) or spawningLabels[targetGuid]

   if label then
      label.destruct()
      labelAssoc[targetGuid] = nil
      spawningLabels[targetGuid] = nil
   end
end

-- fix aspect ratio of card counter itself.
function fixAspectRatio()
   local options = decodeOptionText(self.getDescription(), optionDescriptor)
   local scale = self.getScale()

   scale.z = scale.x * options.aspectratio

   self.setScale(scale)
end

---- utility functions

-- spawn object at relative position of baseObj
--  origin : origin object position, rotation and scale
--   {position = {x = xpos, y = ypos, z = zpos}, rotation = {x = xrot, y = yrot, z = zrot, scale = {x = xscale, y = yscale, z = zscale}}}
--  objParam : object parameter. position and rotation is relative.
--  => objParam
function calcRelativePosition(origin, objParam)
   -- calc scaled position
   objParam.position[1] = objParam.position[1] * origin.scale.x
   objParam.position[2] = objParam.position[2] * origin.scale.y
   objParam.position[3] = objParam.position[3] * origin.scale.z

   -- calc absolute rotation
   objParam.rotation[1] = objParam.rotation[1] + origin.rotation.x
   objParam.rotation[2] = objParam.rotation[2] + origin.rotation.y
   objParam.rotation[3] = objParam.rotation[3] + origin.rotation.z

   -- calc absolute position
   -- y rotation only
   local cosX = math.cos(math.rad(origin.rotation.x))
   local sinX = math.sin(math.rad(origin.rotation.x))
   local cosY = math.cos(math.rad(origin.rotation.y))
   local sinY = math.sin(math.rad(origin.rotation.y))
   local cosZ = math.cos(math.rad(origin.rotation.z))
   local sinZ = math.sin(math.rad(origin.rotation.z))
   local x, y, z = objParam.position[1], objParam.position[2], objParam.position[3]

   -- TTS rotation order: Z-X-Y (same as Unity)

   -- rotate Z axis
   local x1 = x * cosZ - y * sinZ
   local y1 = x * sinZ + y * cosZ
   local z1 = z

   -- rotate X axis
   local x2 = x1
   local y2 = y1 * cosX - z1 * sinX
   local z2 = y1 * sinX + z1 * cosX

   -- rotate Y axis
   local x3 = x2 * cosY + z2 * sinY
   local y3 = y2
   local z3 = -x2 * sinY + z2 * cosY

   objParam.position[1] = x3 + origin.position.x
   objParam.position[2] = y3 + origin.position.y
   objParam.position[3] = z3 + origin.position.z

   return objParam
end

-- convert key=value list to table
--  optionText : string of key(delim)value list delimited by newline
--  descriptor : option entry descriptor
-- => table of key/value
function decodeOptionText(optionText, descriptor)
   local booleanTable = {["true"] = true, ["false"] = false}
   local result = {}

   for i, line in ipairs(split(optionText, "\n")) do
      local key, value = string.match(line, "^%s*([^%s=]+)%s*=%s*(.-)%s*$")
      if key ~= nil then
         key = string.lower(key)

         descEntry = descriptor[key]

         if descEntry then
            if descEntry.type == "select" and descEntry.values then
               value = descEntry.values[string.lower(value)]
            elseif descEntry.type == "boolean" then
               value = booleanTable[string.lower(value)]
            elseif descEntry.type == "number" then
               value = tonumber(value)
            elseif descEntry.type == "custom" and descEntry.decoder then
               value = descEntry.decoder(value, result)
            end
         end

         result[key] = value
      end
   end

   -- recover default value
   for key, descEntry in pairs(descriptor) do
      if result[key] == nil then
         result[key] = descEntry.default
      end
   end

   return result
end

-- split str by delim
--  str : string
--  delim : string
-- => table of string
function split(str, delim)
   local wordStart = 1
   local result = {}

   repeat
      local delimStart, delimEnd = string.find(str, delim, wordStart, 1)

      if delimStart ~= nil then
	 result[#result+1] = string.sub(str, wordStart, delimStart - 1)
	 wordStart = delimEnd + 1
      end
   until delimStart == nil

   result[#result+1] = string.sub(str, wordStart)
   return result
end

-- split "#rrggbb" style color string to "rr", "gg", "bb"
--  hexStr : string
--  => "rr", "gg", "bb"
function splitHexColorString(hexStr)
   if hexStr == nil then
      return nil
   end

   return string.match(hexStr,
                       "^#([%da-fA-F][%da-fA-F])" ..
                          "([%da-fA-F][%da-fA-F])" ..
                          "([%da-fA-F][%da-fA-F])$")
end

-- convert "#rrggbb" style color string to {r, g, b}
--  each element takes between 0 and 1 value.
--  hexStr : string
--  => {r, g, b}
function hexColorStringToRGB(hexStr)
   local result = nil

   local r, g, b = splitHexColorString(hexStr)
   if r then
      result = {tonumber(r, 16) / 255, tonumber(g, 16) / 255, tonumber(b, 16) / 255}
   end
   return result
end

--[[
   card counter
   created by Rodney
]]

cardCounterVersion = "2016111300"

-- constants --
playerColorTable = {}
for i, v in ipairs({"White", "Brown", "Red", "Orange", "Yellow", "Green", "Teal", "Blue", "Purple", "Pink", "Black", "Grey"}) do
   playerColorTable[string.lower(v)] = v
end

-- customizable options in card counter's description part.
optionDescriptor = {
   -- text color.
   -- color name (same as seat name; White, Red...) or "#rrggbb" are supported.
   color = {
      type = "custom",
      decoder = function(value, optionChunk)
         local result
         local regularizedColorName = playerColorTable[string.lower(value)]

         if regularizedColorName then
            local rgb = stringColorToRGB(regularizedColorName)
            result = {rgb.r, rgb.g, rgb.b}
         else
            result = hexColorStringToRGB(value) or {1, 1, 1}
         end

         return result
      end,

      default = {1, 1, 1}
   },

   -- text size.
   size = {
      type = "number",
      default = 44
   },

   -- text format.
   -- See http://www.lua.org/manual/5.2/manual.html#pdf-string.format
   format = {
      type = "string",
      default = "x%d"
   },

   -- text offset position.
   offset = {
      type = "custom",
      decoder = function(value, optionChunk)
         local result = split(value, ",")

         result[1] = tonumber(result[1]) or 0
         result[2] = tonumber(result[2]) or 0
         result[3] = tonumber(result[3]) or 0

         return result
      end,
      default = {0, 0, 0}
   },

   -- text rotation.
   rotation = {
      type = "number",
      default = 0
   },

   -- raise text to deck's height.
   -- if this is true, text is raised to fit to deck's height.
   raise = {
      type = "boolean",
      default = true
   },

   -- aspect ratio.
   -- vertical / horizontal scale.
   aspectratio = {
      type = "number",
      default = 1
   }
}


-- target object's GUID/label text's GUID association table
labelAssoc = {}

-- currently spawning labels (not initialized)
spawningLabels = {}

-- label's temporary spawning position
tempPosition = {0, -30, 0}


-- workaround variable for onLoad/onCollisionEnter event's order.
beforeLoading = true
collideBeforeLoadQueue = {}

-- events --
function onSave()
   return JSON.encode(labelAssoc)
end

function onLoad(saved)
   if saved then
      labelAssoc = JSON.decode(saved) or {}
   end

   for t, l in pairs(labelAssoc) do
      local target = getObjectFromGUID(t)
      local label = getObjectFromGUID(l)

      if label == nil then
         labelAssoc[t] = nil
      elseif target == nil then
         labelAssoc[t] = nil
         label.destruct()
      end
   end

   beforeLoading = false

   for i, v in ipairs(collideBeforeLoadQueue) do
      onCollisionEnter(v)
   end
   collideBeforeLoadQueue = {}

   fixAspectRatio()
end

function onDestroy()
   for t, l in pairs(labelAssoc) do
      destroyLabel(t)
   end
end

function onCollisionEnter(info)
   if info and info.collision_object.guid then
      if beforeLoading then
         collideBeforeLoadQueue[#collideBeforeLoadQueue+1] = info
         return
      end

      local options = decodeOptionText(self.getDescription(), optionDescriptor)
      local target = getObjectFromGUID(info.collision_object.guid)
      local count = -1

      if target.tag == "Card" then
         count = 1
      elseif target.tag == "Deck" then
         count = #target.getObjects()
      end

      -- card/deck only
      if count > -1 then
         if count == 0  then
            destroyLabel(target.guid)
         else
            setLabelText(target.guid, count)
         end
      end
   end
end

function onCollisionExit(info)
   if info and info.collision_object.guid and labelAssoc[info.collision_object.guid] then
      destroyLabel(info.collision_object.guid)
   end
end

function onObjectDestroyed(target)
   if labelAssoc[target.guid] then
      destroyLabel(target.guid)
   end
end

function onPickedUp()
   for t, l in pairs(labelAssoc) do
      destroyLabel(t)
   end

   fixAspectRatio()
end

-- functions --

-- create new label text ofject for targetGuid.
-- this function uses asynchronously callback, so needs mutex variable.
function newLabel(targetGuid, params)
   if spawningLabels[targetGuid] then
      return
   end

   local label = spawnObject({
         type = "3DText",
         position = tempPosition,
         rotation = {0, 0, 0},
         callback = "newLabelCallback",
         callback_owner = self,
         params = {
            targetGuid = targetGuid,
            count = params.count
         }
   })

   spawningLabels[targetGuid] = label

   return label
end

function newLabelCallback(spawnedLabel, params)
   if params.targetGuid then
      labelAssoc[params.targetGuid] = spawnedLabel.guid

      -- move functions only affects after initialized.
      moveLabel(getObjectFromGUID(params.targetGuid), spawnedLabel, params.count)

end

   -- format text

   local raised = 0.165

      elseif count > 214 then
         raised = raised + 0.00966 * (214 - 10)
      else
         raised = raised + 0.00966 * (count - 10)
      end
   end

   local zFace = 0

   local origin = {
      position = target.getPosition(),

      scale = target.getScale()
   }

   -- flipped?
   if origin.rotation.z > 90 and origin.rotation.z < 270 then
      zFace = 180
      offsetDirection = -1
   end

   -- fix height & scale
   -- origin.position.y = self.getPosition().y
   origin.scale.y = 1.0

   local result = calcRelativePosition(origin, {
                                          position = {
                                             offsetDirection * -options.offset[1],
                                             -- offsetDirection * (options.offset[2] + raised),
                                             offsetDirection * (options.offset[2] + raised / 2),
                                             options.offset[3]
                                          },
                                          rotation = {90, 180 + options.rotation, zFace}
   })

   label.setPosition(result.position)
   label.setRotation(result.rotation)
end

function destroyLabel(targetGuid)

      spawningLabels[targetGuid] = nil

         callback = "newLabelCallback",
         callback_owner = self,
         params = {
            targetGuid = targetGuid,
            count = params.count
         }
   })

   spawningLabels[targetGuid] = label

   return label
end

-- callback function for spawning label text object.
function newLabelCallback(spawnedLabel, params)
   if params.targetGuid then
      labelAssoc[params.targetGuid] = spawnedLabel.guid
      local target = getObjectFromGUID(params.targetGuid)

      -- move functions only affects after initialized.
      moveLabel(getObjectFromGUID(params.targetGuid), spawnedLabel, params.count)
   end

   spawningLabels[params.targetGuid] = nil
end

-- set label's text for targetGuid.
-- if label object isn't found, new entity is spawned.
function setLabelText(targetGuid, count)
   local options = decodeOptionText(self.getDescription(), optionDescriptor)
   local label = getObjectFromGUID(labelAssoc[targetGuid])

   if not label then
      label = spawningLabels[targetGuid] or newLabel(targetGuid, {count = count})
   end

   local target = getObjectFromGUID(targetGuid)

   -- rare case: target is destroyed after new label is spawned but not initialized.
   if target == nil then
      destroyLabel(targetGuid)
      return
   end

   -- format text
   label.TextTool.setValue(string.format(options.format, count))
   label.TextTool.setFontColor(options.color)
   label.TextTool.setFontSize(options.size * target.getScale().x)

   -- if already initialized, move here.
   if label.guid then
      moveLabel(target, label, count)
   end
end

function moveLabel(target, label, count)
   local options = decodeOptionText(self.getDescription(), optionDescriptor)

   -- move label position
   local raised = 0.165

   if count ~= nil and options.raise then
      if count < 10 then
         raised = 0.17
      elseif count > 214 then
         raised = raised + 0.00966 * (214 - 10)
      else
         raised = raised + 0.00966 * (count - 10)
      end
   end

   local zFace = 0
   local offsetDirection = 1
   local origin = {
      position = target.getPosition(),
      rotation = target.getRotation(),
      scale = target.getScale()
   }

   -- flipped?
   if origin.rotation.z > 90 and origin.rotation.z < 270 then
      zFace = 180
      offsetDirection = -1
   end

   -- fix height & scale
   -- origin.position.y = self.getPosition().y
   origin.scale.y = 1.0

   local result = calcRelativePosition(origin, {
                                          position = {
                                             offsetDirection * -options.offset[1],
                                             -- offsetDirection * (options.offset[2] + raised),
                                             offsetDirection * (options.offset[2] + raised / 2),
                                             options.offset[3]
                                          },
                                          rotation = {90, 180 + options.rotation, zFace}
   })

   label.setPosition(result.position)
   label.setRotation(result.rotation)
end

-- destroy label object for targetGuid.
function destroyLabel(targetGuid)
   local label = getObjectFromGUID(labelAssoc[targetGuid]) or spawningLabels[targetGuid]

   if label then
      label.destruct()
      labelAssoc[targetGuid] = nil
      spawningLabels[targetGuid] = nil
   end
end

-- fix aspect ratio of card counter itself.
function fixAspectRatio()
   local options = decodeOptionText(self.getDescription(), optionDescriptor)
   local scale = self.getScale()

   scale.z = scale.x * options.aspectratio

   self.setScale(scale)
end

---- utility functions

-- spawn object at relative position of baseObj
--  origin : origin object position, rotation and scale
--   {position = {x = xpos, y = ypos, z = zpos}, rotation = {x = xrot, y = yrot, z = zrot, scale = {x = xscale, y = yscale, z = zscale}}}
--  objParam : object parameter. position and rotation is relative.
--  => objParam
function calcRelativePosition(origin, objParam)
   -- calc scaled position
   objParam.position[1] = objParam.position[1] * origin.scale.x
   objParam.position[2] = objParam.position[2] * origin.scale.y
   objParam.position[3] = objParam.position[3] * origin.scale.z

   -- calc absolute rotation
   objParam.rotation[1] = objParam.rotation[1] + origin.rotation.x
   objParam.rotation[2] = objParam.rotation[2] + origin.rotation.y
   objParam.rotation[3] = objParam.rotation[3] + origin.rotation.z

   -- calc absolute position
   -- y rotation only
   local cosX = math.cos(math.rad(origin.rotation.x))
   local sinX = math.sin(math.rad(origin.rotation.x))
   local cosY = math.cos(math.rad(origin.rotation.y))
   local sinY = math.sin(math.rad(origin.rotation.y))
   local cosZ = math.cos(math.rad(origin.rotation.z))
   local sinZ = math.sin(math.rad(origin.rotation.z))
   local x, y, z = objParam.position[1], objParam.position[2], objParam.position[3]

   -- TTS rotation order: Z-X-Y (same as Unity)

   -- rotate Z axis
   local x1 = x * cosZ - y * sinZ
   local y1 = x * sinZ + y * cosZ
   local z1 = z

   -- rotate X axis
   local x2 = x1
   local y2 = y1 * cosX - z1 * sinX
   local z2 = y1 * sinX + z1 * cosX

   -- rotate Y axis
   local x3 = x2 * cosY + z2 * sinY
   local y3 = y2
   local z3 = -x2 * sinY + z2 * cosY

   objParam.position[1] = x3 + origin.position.x
   objParam.position[2] = y3 + origin.position.y
   objParam.position[3] = z3 + origin.position.z

   return objParam
end

-- convert key=value list to table
--  optionText : string of key(delim)value list delimited by newline
--  descriptor : option entry descriptor
-- => table of key/value
function decodeOptionText(optionText, descriptor)
   local booleanTable = {["true"] = true, ["false"] = false}
   local result = {}

   for i, line in ipairs(split(optionText, "\n")) do
      local key, value = string.match(line, "^%s*([^%s=]+)%s*=%s*(.-)%s*$")
      if key ~= nil then
         key = string.lower(key)

         descEntry = descriptor[key]

         if descEntry then
            if descEntry.type == "select" and descEntry.values then
               value = descEntry.values[string.lower(value)]
            elseif descEntry.type == "boolean" then
               value = booleanTable[string.lower(value)]
            elseif descEntry.type == "number" then
               value = tonumber(value)
            elseif descEntry.type == "custom" and descEntry.decoder then
               value = descEntry.decoder(value, result)
            end
         end

         result[key] = value
      end
   end

   -- recover default value
   for key, descEntry in pairs(descriptor) do
      if result[key] == nil then
         result[key] = descEntry.default
      end
   end

   return result
end

-- split str by delim
--  str : string
--  delim : string
-- => table of string
function split(str, delim)
   local wordStart = 1
   local result = {}

   repeat
      local delimStart, delimEnd = string.find(str, delim, wordStart, 1)

      if delimStart ~= nil then
	 result[#result+1] = string.sub(str, wordStart, delimStart - 1)
	 wordStart = delimEnd + 1
      end
   until delimStart == nil

   result[#result+1] = string.sub(str, wordStart)
   return result
end

-- split "#rrggbb" style color string to "rr", "gg", "bb"
--  hexStr : string
--  => "rr", "gg", "bb"
function splitHexColorString(hexStr)
   if hexStr == nil then
      return nil
   end

   return string.match(hexStr,
                       "^#([%da-fA-F][%da-fA-F])" ..
                          "([%da-fA-F][%da-fA-F])" ..
                          "([%da-fA-F][%da-fA-F])$")
end

-- convert "#rrggbb" style color string to {r, g, b}
--  each element takes between 0 and 1 value.
--  hexStr : string
--  => {r, g, b}
function hexColorStringToRGB(hexStr)
   local result = nil

   local r, g, b = splitHexColorString(hexStr)
   if r then
      result = {tonumber(r, 16) / 255, tonumber(g, 16) / 255, tonumber(b, 16) / 255}
   end
   return result
end

--[[
   card counter
   created by Rodney
]]

cardCounterVersion = "2016111300"

-- constants --
playerColorTable = {}
for i, v in ipairs({"White", "Brown", "Red", "Orange", "Yellow", "Green", "Teal", "Blue", "Purple", "Pink", "Black", "Grey"}) do
   playerColorTable[string.lower(v)] = v
end

-- customizable options in card counter's description part.
optionDescriptor = {
   -- text color.
   -- color name (same as seat name; White, Red...) or "#rrggbb" are supported.
   color = {
      type = "custom",
      decoder = function(value, optionChunk)
         local result
         local regularizedColorName = playerColorTable[string.lower(value)]

         if regularizedColorName then
            local rgb = stringColorToRGB(regularizedColorName)
            result = {rgb.r, rgb.g, rgb.b}
         else
            result = hexColorStringToRGB(value) or {1, 1, 1}
         end

         return result
      end,

      default = {1, 1, 1}
   },

   -- text size.
   size = {
      type = "number",
      default = 44
   },

   -- text format.
   -- See http://www.lua.org/manual/5.2/manual.html#pdf-string.format
   format = {
      type = "string",
      default = "x%d"
   },

   -- text offset position.
   offset = {
      type = "custom",
      decoder = function(value, optionChunk)
         local result = split(value, ",")

         result[1] = tonumber(result[1]) or 0
         result[2] = tonumber(result[2]) or 0
         result[3] = tonumber(result[3]) or 0

         return result
      end,
      default = {0, 0, 0}
   },

   -- text rotation.
   rotation = {
      type = "number",
      default = 0
   },

   -- raise text to deck's height.
   -- if this is true, text is raised to fit to deck's height.
   raise = {
      type = "boolean",
      default = true
   },

   -- aspect ratio.
   -- vertical / horizontal scale.
   aspectratio = {
      type = "number",
      default = 1
   }
}


-- target object's GUID/label text's GUID association table
labelAssoc = {}

-- currently spawning labels (not initialized)
spawningLabels = {}

-- label's temporary spawning position
tempPosition = {0, -30, 0}


-- workaround variable for onLoad/onCollisionEnter event's order.
beforeLoading = true
collideBeforeLoadQueue = {}

-- events --
function onSave()
   return JSON.encode(labelAssoc)
end

function onLoad(saved)
   if saved then
      labelAssoc = JSON.decode(saved) or {}
   end

   for t, l in pairs(labelAssoc) do
      local target = getObjectFromGUID(t)
      local label = getObjectFromGUID(l)

      if label == nil then
         labelAssoc[t] = nil
      elseif target == nil then
         labelAssoc[t] = nil
         label.destruct()
      end
   end

   beforeLoading = false

   for i, v in ipairs(collideBeforeLoadQueue) do
      onCollisionEnter(v)
   end
   collideBeforeLoadQueue = {}

   fixAspectRatio()
end

function onDestroy()
   for t, l in pairs(labelAssoc) do
      destroyLabel(t)
   end
end

function onCollisionEnter(info)
   if info and info.collision_object.guid then
      if beforeLoading then
         collideBeforeLoadQueue[#collideBeforeLoadQueue+1] = info
         return
      end

      local options = decodeOptionText(self.getDescription(), optionDescriptor)
      local target = getObjectFromGUID(info.collision_object.guid)
      local count = -1

      if target.tag == "Card" then
         count = 1
      elseif target.tag == "Deck" then
         count = #target.getObjects()
      end

      -- card/deck only
      if count > -1 then
         if count == 0  then
            destroyLabel(target.guid)
         else
            setLabelText(target.guid, count)
         end
      end
   end
end

function onCollisionExit(info)
   if info and info.collision_object.guid and labelAssoc[info.collision_object.guid] then
      destroyLabel(info.collision_object.guid)
   end
end

function onObjectDestroyed(target)
   if labelAssoc[target.guid] then
      destroyLabel(target.guid)
   end
end

function onPickedUp()
   for t, l in pairs(labelAssoc) do
      destroyLabel(t)
   end

   fixAspectRatio()
end

-- functions --

-- create new label text ofject for targetGuid.
-- this function uses asynchronously callback, so needs mutex variable.
function newLabel(targetGuid, params)
   if spawningLabels[targetGuid] then
      return
   end

   local label = spawnObject({
         type = "3DText",
         position = tempPosition,
         rotation = {0, 0, 0},
         callback = "newLabelCallback",
         callback_owner = self,
         params = {
            targetGuid = targetGuid,
            count = params.count
         }
   })

   spawningLabels[targetGuid] = label

   return label
end

function newLabelCallback(spawnedLabel, params)
   if params.targetGuid then
      labelAssoc[params.targetGuid] = spawnedLabel.guid

      -- move functions only affects after initialized.
      moveLabel(getObjectFromGUID(params.targetGuid), spawnedLabel, params.count)

end

   -- format text

   local raised = 0.165

      elseif count > 214 then
         raised = raised + 0.00966 * (214 - 10)
      else
         raised = raised + 0.00966 * (count - 10)
      end
   end

   local zFace = 0

   local origin = {
      position = target.getPosition(),

      scale = target.getScale()
   }

   -- flipped?
   if origin.rotation.z > 90 and origin.rotation.z < 270 then
      zFace = 180
      offsetDirection = -1
   end

   -- fix height & scale
   -- origin.position.y = self.getPosition().y
   origin.scale.y = 1.0

   local result = calcRelativePosition(origin, {
                                          position = {
                                             offsetDirection * -options.offset[1],
                                             -- offsetDirection * (options.offset[2] + raised),
                                             offsetDirection * (options.offset[2] + raised / 2),
                                             options.offset[3]
                                          },
                                          rotation = {90, 180 + options.rotation, zFace}
   })

   label.setPosition(result.position)
   label.setRotation(result.rotation)
end

function destroyLabel(targetGuid)

      spawningLabels[targetGuid] = nil

         callback = "newLabelCallback",
         callback_owner = self,
         params = {
            targetGuid = targetGuid,
            count = params.count
         }
   })

   spawningLabels[targetGuid] = label

   return label
end

-- callback function for spawning label text object.
function newLabelCallback(spawnedLabel, params)
   if params.targetGuid then
      labelAssoc[params.targetGuid] = spawnedLabel.guid
      local target = getObjectFromGUID(params.targetGuid)

      -- move functions only affects after initialized.
      moveLabel(getObjectFromGUID(params.targetGuid), spawnedLabel, params.count)
   end

   spawningLabels[params.targetGuid] = nil
end

-- set label's text for targetGuid.
-- if label object isn't found, new entity is spawned.
function setLabelText(targetGuid, count)
   local options = decodeOptionText(self.getDescription(), optionDescriptor)
   local label = getObjectFromGUID(labelAssoc[targetGuid])

   if not label then
      label = spawningLabels[targetGuid] or newLabel(targetGuid, {count = count})
   end

   local target = getObjectFromGUID(targetGuid)

   -- rare case: target is destroyed after new label is spawned but not initialized.
   if target == nil then
      destroyLabel(targetGuid)
      return
   end

   -- format text
   label.TextTool.setValue(string.format(options.format, count))
   label.TextTool.setFontColor(options.color)
   label.TextTool.setFontSize(options.size * target.getScale().x)

   -- if already initialized, move here.
   if label.guid then
      moveLabel(target, label, count)
   end
end

function moveLabel(target, label, count)
   local options = decodeOptionText(self.getDescription(), optionDescriptor)

   -- move label position
   local raised = 0.165

   if count ~= nil and options.raise then
      if count < 10 then
         raised = 0.17
      elseif count > 214 then
         raised = raised + 0.00966 * (214 - 10)
      else
         raised = raised + 0.00966 * (count - 10)
      end
   end

   local zFace = 0
   local offsetDirection = 1
   local origin = {
      position = target.getPosition(),
      rotation = target.getRotation(),
      scale = target.getScale()
   }

   -- flipped?
   if origin.rotation.z > 90 and origin.rotation.z < 270 then
      zFace = 180
      offsetDirection = -1
   end

   -- fix height & scale
   -- origin.position.y = self.getPosition().y
   origin.scale.y = 1.0

   local result = calcRelativePosition(origin, {
                                          position = {
                                             offsetDirection * -options.offset[1],
                                             -- offsetDirection * (options.offset[2] + raised),
                                             offsetDirection * (options.offset[2] + raised / 2),
                                             options.offset[3]
                                          },
                                          rotation = {90, 180 + options.rotation, zFace}
   })

   label.setPosition(result.position)
   label.setRotation(result.rotation)
end

-- destroy label object for targetGuid.
function destroyLabel(targetGuid)
   local label = getObjectFromGUID(labelAssoc[targetGuid]) or spawningLabels[targetGuid]

   if label then
      label.destruct()
      labelAssoc[targetGuid] = nil
      spawningLabels[targetGuid] = nil
   end
end

-- fix aspect ratio of card counter itself.
function fixAspectRatio()
   local options = decodeOptionText(self.getDescription(), optionDescriptor)
   local scale = self.getScale()

   scale.z = scale.x * options.aspectratio

   self.setScale(scale)
end

---- utility functions

-- spawn object at relative position of baseObj
--  origin : origin object position, rotation and scale
--   {position = {x = xpos, y = ypos, z = zpos}, rotation = {x = xrot, y = yrot, z = zrot, scale = {x = xscale, y = yscale, z = zscale}}}
--  objParam : object parameter. position and rotation is relative.
--  => objParam
function calcRelativePosition(origin, objParam)
   -- calc scaled position
   objParam.position[1] = objParam.position[1] * origin.scale.x
   objParam.position[2] = objParam.position[2] * origin.scale.y
   objParam.position[3] = objParam.position[3] * origin.scale.z

   -- calc absolute rotation
   objParam.rotation[1] = objParam.rotation[1] + origin.rotation.x
   objParam.rotation[2] = objParam.rotation[2] + origin.rotation.y
   objParam.rotation[3] = objParam.rotation[3] + origin.rotation.z

   -- calc absolute position
   -- y rotation only
   local cosX = math.cos(math.rad(origin.rotation.x))
   local sinX = math.sin(math.rad(origin.rotation.x))
   local cosY = math.cos(math.rad(origin.rotation.y))
   local sinY = math.sin(math.rad(origin.rotation.y))
   local cosZ = math.cos(math.rad(origin.rotation.z))
   local sinZ = math.sin(math.rad(origin.rotation.z))
   local x, y, z = objParam.position[1], objParam.position[2], objParam.position[3]

   -- TTS rotation order: Z-X-Y (same as Unity)

   -- rotate Z axis
   local x1 = x * cosZ - y * sinZ
   local y1 = x * sinZ + y * cosZ
   local z1 = z

   -- rotate X axis
   local x2 = x1
   local y2 = y1 * cosX - z1 * sinX
   local z2 = y1 * sinX + z1 * cosX

   -- rotate Y axis
   local x3 = x2 * cosY + z2 * sinY
   local y3 = y2
   local z3 = -x2 * sinY + z2 * cosY

   objParam.position[1] = x3 + origin.position.x
   objParam.position[2] = y3 + origin.position.y
   objParam.position[3] = z3 + origin.position.z

   return objParam
end

-- convert key=value list to table
--  optionText : string of key(delim)value list delimited by newline
--  descriptor : option entry descriptor
-- => table of key/value
function decodeOptionText(optionText, descriptor)
   local booleanTable = {["true"] = true, ["false"] = false}
   local result = {}

   for i, line in ipairs(split(optionText, "\n")) do
      local key, value = string.match(line, "^%s*([^%s=]+)%s*=%s*(.-)%s*$")
      if key ~= nil then
         key = string.lower(key)

         descEntry = descriptor[key]

         if descEntry then
            if descEntry.type == "select" and descEntry.values then
               value = descEntry.values[string.lower(value)]
            elseif descEntry.type == "boolean" then
               value = booleanTable[string.lower(value)]
            elseif descEntry.type == "number" then
               value = tonumber(value)
            elseif descEntry.type == "custom" and descEntry.decoder then
               value = descEntry.decoder(value, result)
            end
         end

         result[key] = value
      end
   end

   -- recover default value
   for key, descEntry in pairs(descriptor) do
      if result[key] == nil then
         result[key] = descEntry.default
      end
   end

   return result
end

-- split str by delim
--  str : string
--  delim : string
-- => table of string
function split(str, delim)
   local wordStart = 1
   local result = {}

   repeat
      local delimStart, delimEnd = string.find(str, delim, wordStart, 1)

      if delimStart ~= nil then
	 result[#result+1] = string.sub(str, wordStart, delimStart - 1)
	 wordStart = delimEnd + 1
      end
   until delimStart == nil

   result[#result+1] = string.sub(str, wordStart)
   return result
end

-- split "#rrggbb" style color string to "rr", "gg", "bb"
--  hexStr : string
--  => "rr", "gg", "bb"
function splitHexColorString(hexStr)
   if hexStr == nil then
      return nil
   end

   return string.match(hexStr,
                       "^#([%da-fA-F][%da-fA-F])" ..
                          "([%da-fA-F][%da-fA-F])" ..
                          "([%da-fA-F][%da-fA-F])$")
end

-- convert "#rrggbb" style color string to {r, g, b}
--  each element takes between 0 and 1 value.
--  hexStr : string
--  => {r, g, b}
function hexColorStringToRGB(hexStr)
   local result = nil

   local r, g, b = splitHexColorString(hexStr)
   if r then
      result = {tonumber(r, 16) / 255, tonumber(g, 16) / 255, tonumber(b, 16) / 255}
   end
   return result
end

--[[
   card counter
   created by Rodney
]]

cardCounterVersion = "2016111300"

-- constants --
playerColorTable = {}
for i, v in ipairs({"White", "Brown", "Red", "Orange", "Yellow", "Green", "Teal", "Blue", "Purple", "Pink", "Black", "Grey"}) do
   playerColorTable[string.lower(v)] = v
end

-- customizable options in card counter's description part.
optionDescriptor = {
   -- text color.
   -- color name (same as seat name; White, Red...) or "#rrggbb" are supported.
   color = {
      type = "custom",
      decoder = function(value, optionChunk)
         local result
         local regularizedColorName = playerColorTable[string.lower(value)]

         if regularizedColorName then
            local rgb = stringColorToRGB(regularizedColorName)
            result = {rgb.r, rgb.g, rgb.b}
         else
            result = hexColorStringToRGB(value) or {1, 1, 1}
         end

         return result
      end,

      default = {1, 1, 1}
   },

   -- text size.
   size = {
      type = "number",
      default = 44
   },

   -- text format.
   -- See http://www.lua.org/manual/5.2/manual.html#pdf-string.format
   format = {
      type = "string",
      default = "x%d"
   },

   -- text offset position.
   offset = {
      type = "custom",
      decoder = function(value, optionChunk)
         local result = split(value, ",")

         result[1] = tonumber(result[1]) or 0
         result[2] = tonumber(result[2]) or 0
         result[3] = tonumber(result[3]) or 0

         return result
      end,
      default = {0, 0, 0}
   },

   -- text rotation.
   rotation = {
      type = "number",
      default = 0
   },

   -- raise text to deck's height.
   -- if this is true, text is raised to fit to deck's height.
   raise = {
      type = "boolean",
      default = true
   },

   -- aspect ratio.
   -- vertical / horizontal scale.
   aspectratio = {
      type = "number",
      default = 1
   }
}


-- target object's GUID/label text's GUID association table
labelAssoc = {}

-- currently spawning labels (not initialized)
spawningLabels = {}

-- label's temporary spawning position
tempPosition = {0, -30, 0}


-- workaround variable for onLoad/onCollisionEnter event's order.
beforeLoading = true
collideBeforeLoadQueue = {}

-- events --
function onSave()
   return JSON.encode(labelAssoc)
end

function onLoad(saved)
   if saved then
      labelAssoc = JSON.decode(saved) or {}
   end

   for t, l in pairs(labelAssoc) do
      local target = getObjectFromGUID(t)
      local label = getObjectFromGUID(l)

      if label == nil then
         labelAssoc[t] = nil
      elseif target == nil then
         labelAssoc[t] = nil
         label.destruct()
      end
   end

   beforeLoading = false

   for i, v in ipairs(collideBeforeLoadQueue) do
      onCollisionEnter(v)
   end
   collideBeforeLoadQueue = {}

   fixAspectRatio()
end

function onDestroy()
   for t, l in pairs(labelAssoc) do
      destroyLabel(t)
   end
end

function onCollisionEnter(info)
   if info and info.collision_object.guid then
      if beforeLoading then
         collideBeforeLoadQueue[#collideBeforeLoadQueue+1] = info
         return
      end

      local options = decodeOptionText(self.getDescription(), optionDescriptor)
      local target = getObjectFromGUID(info.collision_object.guid)
      local count = -1

      if target.tag == "Card" then
         count = 1
      elseif target.tag == "Deck" then
         count = #target.getObjects()
      end

      -- card/deck only
      if count > -1 then
         if count == 0  then
            destroyLabel(target.guid)
         else
            setLabelText(target.guid, count)
         end
      end
   end
end

function onCollisionExit(info)
   if info and info.collision_object.guid and labelAssoc[info.collision_object.guid] then
      destroyLabel(info.collision_object.guid)
   end
end

function onObjectDestroyed(target)
   if labelAssoc[target.guid] then
      destroyLabel(target.guid)
   end
end

function onPickedUp()
   for t, l in pairs(labelAssoc) do
      destroyLabel(t)
   end

   fixAspectRatio()
end

-- functions --

-- create new label text ofject for targetGuid.
-- this function uses asynchronously callback, so needs mutex variable.
function newLabel(targetGuid, params)
   if spawningLabels[targetGuid] then
      return
   end

   local label = spawnObject({
         type = "3DText",
         position = tempPosition,
         rotation = {0, 0, 0},
         callback = "newLabelCallback",
         callback_owner = self,
         params = {
            targetGuid = targetGuid,
            count = params.count
         }
   })

   spawningLabels[targetGuid] = label

   return label
end

function newLabelCallback(spawnedLabel, params)
   if params.targetGuid then
      labelAssoc[params.targetGuid] = spawnedLabel.guid

      -- move functions only affects after initialized.
      moveLabel(getObjectFromGUID(params.targetGuid), spawnedLabel, params.count)

end

   -- format text

   local raised = 0.165

      elseif count > 214 then
         raised = raised + 0.00966 * (214 - 10)
      else
         raised = raised + 0.00966 * (count - 10)
      end
   end

   local zFace = 0

   local origin = {
      position = target.getPosition(),

      scale = target.getScale()
   }

   -- flipped?
   if origin.rotation.z > 90 and origin.rotation.z < 270 then
      zFace = 180
      offsetDirection = -1
   end

   -- fix height & scale
   -- origin.position.y = self.getPosition().y
   origin.scale.y = 1.0

   local result = calcRelativePosition(origin, {
                                          position = {
                                             offsetDirection * -options.offset[1],
                                             -- offsetDirection * (options.offset[2] + raised),
                                             offsetDirection * (options.offset[2] + raised / 2),
                                             options.offset[3]
                                          },
                                          rotation = {90, 180 + options.rotation, zFace}
   })

   label.setPosition(result.position)
   label.setRotation(result.rotation)
end

function destroyLabel(targetGuid)

      spawningLabels[targetGuid] = nil
